hints_html: Draw an arrow from point A to point B provided the entry in column A row B is not zero. For example in column 1 row 2 there is a nonzero entry. Draw an arrow from point 1 to point 2. Continue through the matrix.
hints_latex:
Draw an arrow from point A to point B provided the entry in column A row
B is not zero. For example in column 1 row 2 there is a nonzero entry.
Draw an arrow from point 1 to point 2. Continue through the matrix.
hints_raw: Draw an arrow from point A to point B provided the entry in column A row B is not zero. For example in column 1 row 2 there is a nonzero entry. Draw an arrow from point 1 to point 2. Continue through the matrix.
question: 5 (a)

statement_html:
Consider an internet with six sites. The stochastic matrix describing the behaviour of a web surfer (with damping factor zero) is

\[\begin{aligned} P = \begin{bmatrix} 0 & 0 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & 0 \\ \frac12 & 0 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & 0 & \frac12 \\ \frac12 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & \frac12 & 0 \\ 0 & \frac13 & 0 & 1 & 0 & \frac12 \\ 0 & 0 & \frac13 & 0 & \frac12 & 0 \end{bmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

(a) Draw the internet link corresponding to the matrix P on the following diagram.
statement_raw:
Consider an internet with six sites. The stochastic matrix describing the behaviour of a web surfer (with damping factor zero) is

:<math>
P = \begin{bmatrix}
0 & 0 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & 0 \\
\frac12 & 0 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & 0 \\
0 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & 0 & \frac12 \\
\frac12 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & \frac12 & 0 \\
0 & \frac13 & 0 & 1 & 0 & \frac12 \\
0 & 0 & \frac13 & 0 & \frac12 & 0
\end{bmatrix}
</math>

'''(a)''' Draw the internet link corresponding to the matrix ''P'' on the following diagram.

:[[File:MATH307December2012Q5.png|200px]]
